block.p: Nicole Edwards Morris, the daughter of Elena and Mark Morris of Snedens Landing, N.Y., was married yesterday to John Keil Merrick, the son of Cynthia and Fred Merrick II of Shaker Heights, Ohio. The Rev. Edward Anderson, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated, and the Rev. Laurie Ferguson, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony at the Unitarian Universalist Church in Nantucket, Mass.

Mrs. Merrick, 26, is an account supervisor at BBDO, the advertising agency in New York. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. Her father is chairman of the North American division of Bates Worldwide, the advertising agency, in New York. Her mother is a consultant to the office of adult learning services of the College Board, the educational testing organization in New York.

Nicole Edwards Morris, the daughter of Elena and Mark Morris of Snedens Landing, N.Y., was married yesterday to John Keil Merrick, the son of Cynthia and Fred Merrick II of Shaker Heights, Ohio. The Rev. Edward Anderson, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated, and the Rev. Laurie Ferguson, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony at the Unitarian Universalist Church in Nantucket, Mass.

Mrs. Merrick, 26, is an account supervisor at BBDO, the advertising agency in New York. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. Her father is chairman of the North American division of Bates Worldwide, the advertising agency, in New York. Her mother is a consultant to the office of adult learning services of the College Board, the educational testing organization in New York.

Mr. Merrick, 28, is known as Keil. He is the vice president for sales and marketing at Cole Systems Associates, technology consultants in New York. He graduated from Trinity College in Hartford. His father is the owner of Van Cleef Asset Management in Cleveland. His mother produces a municipal cable-television program on public affairs for Shaker Heights.
